website_summaries.verdict: Traditional burlap sacks are both simple and effective.
pros: Classic burlap sacks are durable and can be reused for multiple races
Can also be repurposed for gardening or lawn work
23 x 40 inch bags ideal for kids and adults
Easily label or draw on bags with a marker
cons: Burlap has a strong scent, air your sacks out before use

customer_reviews.title: Horrible chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: Like many reviewers I was shocked by how much chemical smell these things have. It's insanely strong and smells like mineral spirits or kerosine. I got sucks to make a costume for party so when I put my head into it I almost passed out. I'm airing them outside right now, but I'm pretty sure they are not supposed to smell like this.
customer_reviews.author: SpaceSheep1

customer_reviews.title: Not new!!!
customer_reviews.text: These were not new. They are dirty and one had dirt/mud like a tar almost and the other one is marked up by markers. I bought to use for Christmas gifts and there is no way you can use these for that purpose. They left a mess everywhere almost like they are used peanut shell bags. The sticker on the packing says new. Do not buy if you want for anything other than outside use. 😡
customer_reviews.author: Tenley Denton

customer_reviews.title: No!
customer_reviews.text: Thought it would be fun for a kids birthday party (memories of childhood) , but the ones we got delivered were not what you want to use: scratchy, very loosely woven and cheaply sewn together. At least one had a repair patch and one sack was much smaller than the others. Had they actually been used they would have fallen apart right there. To my dismay I forgot to bring them with me when I left the birthday party (60miles away) or else I would have returned them, unused. Supposedly good for gardeners though (according to some reviews I read) . Had no idea- maybe these sacks are still good for something, just not sack hopping.
customer_reviews.author: gattigalore

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Sacks came with 3” - 4” holes in spots. I realize burlap is suppose to look “rustic” but this was ridiculous. I had to use all 4 bags to piece together the project I needed them for. Sizing should have required just 2. I am very disappointed but I need them done for tomorrow so I had no choice but to use. Otherwise I would have returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ghillie jute
customer_reviews.text: Used to before everyone went to “paintball” super secret ninja fake Ghillie material you could buy Jute by the bundle now we are are back to using potato sacks but no soldier has ever complained about creating his Ghillie that way the bundles were just convenient. These bags work fantastic for creating tree tucks and rifle drapes. Those who are trained know the drill and I have to say these bags shag out well and bond and gather like judge should they are also the lowest price I’ve found take clay well and don’t dry rot nearly as fast in extremely humid environments like some of the others do good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Theresa M.

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: ....for growing potatoes. Roll the sides down, plant potatoes in an inch or two and as they start to grow roll the sides up and fill with more dirt. Dump out a sack of potatoes at the end of the growing season.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet potato

customer_reviews.title: Good size new sack great for allowing air to circulate
customer_reviews.text: Very good large jute bag. Definitely smells of new burlap material. Cord size is about 1/8" and sturdy although noticed the weave in areas was somewhat loose which can lead to small size items (1/8" or so) to pass through. Would have gone for 5 stars if had a drawstring sewn in to secure the top and bit tighter weave. I used some short pieces of rope to tie up the bags but have to be careful they don't slip/roll them over the top.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bean

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a game to play at a party and they are durable and a lot of fun... though we've only had for a couple months we've used them a number of times. I think they will hold up for a long time or at least I hope.
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: I was embarrassed-the sacks were for school outing and they fell apart!
customer_reviews.text: These sacks were ordered for a school outing at the end of the school year. My girls participated in the races, but they were already broken by the time they used them. The sacks had holes and most have handles, but these did not. The sacks were not at all durable for the purpose intended. Burlap sacks are for children to race in and these weren't suitable for their intense purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Jane A. Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Great Size Burlap Bag
customer_reviews.text: I needed some burlap bags in this size for a project. These potato sacks fit the bill and were better quality than I had expected. As others have noted, the smell was very strong. I let them sit outside for 2 weeks and sprayed them with febreze every third day to get rid of most of the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Guitar Player

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a recent mission trip to Jamaica. I needed something that I could pack that was light and that had a lot of play value. The kids we played with loved them and we had a lot of fun. The hardest part was getting them to take turns without fighting. LOL
customer_reviews.author: MamaFields

customer_reviews.title: STURDY with an easily resolved smell.
customer_reviews.text: Last year we ordered colorful sacks that had handles. Big mistake! They tore on the practice run. These bags did have a smell when they were taking out of the package. Based on the reviews we read, we opened them and left them in the shed for a few days. Smell was a non-issue and they held up beautifully during our field day activities. I expect them to last several years.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Dolan

customer_reviews.title: Open and air out when these arrive.
customer_reviews.text: I got these to wrap some unusual presents. I put a 20 inch spinner suitcase loaded up with presents inside in one bag. Tied with nice wire ribbon and it worked well. Also used for wrapping on a full size personalized axe for my brother. Also handy for future. Left them to be used for gunny sack races when spring arrives
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The smell is AWFUL!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect size for our first graders for a sack race, however they reek of some sort of chemical treatment. And it doesn’t wear off. We’ve had them hanging outside for days to ‘air them out’. Really nauseating.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for crafting just add imagination
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for crafting!! Sturdy but was even pliable enough for mask making. We used it to make a few custom burlap costume masks for a film. Also makes some great Halloween props, just add water, glue, time and imagination!!
customer_reviews.author: Okt31

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful burlap for fall decor
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to receive nice clean burlap for my nightmare before Xmas project. It made a wonderful oogie boogie! Next up painting it green. It had enough stretch & kept its shape!
customer_reviews.author: Katapillar

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a Luau Pig bag
customer_reviews.text: Soaked the bags in marinade (white wine, apple juice and apple cider vinegar) and put a few over the pig before burying it in the ground with hot rocks for 24. Kept the meat steamed and moist and kept the dirt off
customer_reviews.author: Lion

customer_reviews.title: Overpowering Chemical Smell
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for Halloween to put goody bags in for a theme. I aired them out outside as well for a day or two. They smelled so badly of chemicals that I threw them out!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Kelleher

customer_reviews.title: Quality is good, and product is as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I received the sacks on the day promised. I created plant potting containers out of two of them the day I received them. They hold the potting soil in just fine and will certainly hold up all growing season.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS GARBAGE IT STINK LIKE KEROSENE OIL
customer_reviews.text: The crocus bag stinks it smellsike straight kerosene oil. I tried spraying with febreze still there, I thought to wash them big mistake it smells the same and start shedding like a cat. NEVER BUY THIS YOU WILL REGRET IT!@@
customer_reviews.author: Nadine Downey

customer_reviews.title: Great bags
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews, some complained of a smell. I ordered anyway. The are beautiful burlap bags that smell like burlap. No offensive order at all. I’m using mine to place large plant tubers in to dry out for winter. Great bags. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: C.L.

customer_reviews.title: Smell is awful and hard to get rid of
customer_reviews.text: The smell is absolutely horrible after washing and airing out for 2 days and another dip in dish soap and fabric softener it still smells not as bad because of the fabric softener but still there. Wouldn’t buy again and if I didn’t need for costume I’d have returned them. I couldn’t imagine kids using them for races without smelling like kerosene after 😒
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Used for a costume
customer_reviews.text: My use for these sacks was to cut up for a voodoo doll costume. Per other comments (for this and other sacks), they do have a gasoline-like smell. I sprayed with Lysol and just let them air out for 2 weeks. The smell dissipated, no complaints from my very picky daughter who wore the costume.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Santorios

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: So we used these sacks for a race with our grandshuggas. 3 boys. They ran, fell, and laughed the entire time. So glad we bought these to be apart of our fun day. Great fun
customer_reviews.author: Blessvince

customer_reviews.title: Hold you’re nose
customer_reviews.text: These things smell horrible, like some sort of fuel. I returned them and got the man made ones. I didn’t want these fast kids catching fire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: These really smell like chemicals a lot. They are fine, especially for the price but they are horribly stinky- like they’ve been dipped in formaldehyde. I’m airing them outside since kids will be using them
customer_reviews.author: Amy M.

customer_reviews.title: Hold your nose!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible smell the moment I opened the bag that contains the burlap sacks. The weave is loose, can’t imagine it would hold up well (I bought for part of a costume); dropped debris everywhere. Can’t get it out if my house soon enough. Would only imagine you could use for outdoor purposes.
customer_reviews.author: J&K in CA

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you’d expect
customer_reviews.text: They’re burlap sacks. Nothing special here. The smell when opening is really bad, like a strong chemical small. My entire classroom reeked, we had to go outside for a bit. Other than that they are perfectly fine. I haven’t noticed the smell since the first day.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: I was worried when I received these that would fall apart, but the kids had sack races in them and goofed off and they held together great! They stunk when I first pulled them out, but just let them air out. Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Starr

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas Savings!
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to find a large burlap bag that would hold my sons' baby clothes and toys they had when they were young. They are 46 and 42 now. Most burlap bags started at $20 and up. So when I spotted these, I had to order them. The bags are great! I bought red and green ribbon and bows. This idea solved two problems. What to buy two grown men who have everything? Emptied tubs which cleared out more closet space for me. Bonus--I spent hardly any money!
customer_reviews.author: jayme cessna

customer_reviews.title: Smell
customer_reviews.text: Worked exactly as I needed them to but the chemical smell is HORRIBLE. Let air out for awhile before you need to use them
customer_reviews.author: ABourgeois

customer_reviews.title: Great Burlap Sacks
customer_reviews.text: I got these burlap bags to use as a wrap for the bottom of Christmas trees for the natural look. The sacks worked wonderfully, and had minimal burlap smell. Since some of the bags are outside on the front porch, I expect the exposure to the elements for over a month may deteriorate the sacks, so I will order more for next time.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Not just for sack racing
customer_reviews.text: These worked out great, we didn't purchase these to have a sack race although i think they would work great for that, we got them to cover our sensitive bushes for the winter, they are perfect, not too thick or heavy. I will let you know after the winter how they held up but we are not worried. The shipping was fast too so i wouldn't hesitate to order from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Strange chemical odor.
customer_reviews.text: I gambled on these after seeing reviews that these had a strange chemical odor. Mine also had the odor. They also did not take clothing dye as well as others I have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Feet poked through the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for end of the school year Super Kids Day. Lasted through 10 kids and then there were holes in the bottom. Didn't last the whole day.
customer_reviews.author: BHS Assoc

customer_reviews.title: Kerosene smell!
customer_reviews.text: The smell is awful - like someone poured kerosene on them. I’ve washed them twice. If anything they smell worse. Someone said to soak them in vinegar. Not sure yet how they’ll stand up to that.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good fun
customer_reviews.text: It had alot of loose material inside the bag which got on our clothes but held up good even for the adults to jump in them
customer_reviews.author: M.P

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: The burlap bags arrived one day early. They were enclosed in a sturdy carton of appropriate size. The bags,themselves, were just what I anticipated. If I were to need more of these bags...I would surely purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Horrible/unusable.
customer_reviews.text: Completely stank. Seemed like they were dipped in turpentine. Horrible/unusable. Missed return window otherwise I would have sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Carlow

customer_reviews.title: Soaked in chemicals
customer_reviews.text: So I bought these for a halloween lesson and wish I would have never brought them into my classroom. First off, they reek of chemicals. Like, STRONG CHEMICALS. I couldn't even do the activity because it was sooo strong. There are little tiny pieces that shed off of the sacks and they got everywhere. Kinda disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Christalynn

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just like the sacks I remember growing up with when cattle feed was bought at M.F.A.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Potatoriffic!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought these potato sacks to help me carry my potatoes from the fields to the house. See I am an urban farmer and we can't grow that many and I have to walk up many flights of stairs from my potato "fields" to my apartment. After several trips, I decided to take a break from farming and I left the sacks on the sidewalk. Some local kids came up and asked what they were and started getting inside them. Soon enough they were hopping around and racing! Well, oddly enough, these potato sacks turned out to be better for racing than carrying potatoes! WHO KNEW! I smell a game on our hands.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Ashby

customer_reviews.title: Stinky and sheds
customer_reviews.text: Yes these are burlap bags and totally what I was looking for. Was a bit surprised by the smell and shed factor yet I'm told that is what burlap "is".
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: School Field Day
customer_reviews.text: As a homeroom mom for my children's school and in charge of putting together field day, I was looking for an outdoor item that would be fun for our fourth graders to play with. The children had a ton of fun. I was pleased with the material which was burlap, sturdy and thin and flexible at the same time. Would recommend to anyone looking for an outdoor activity. This would be fun for any age and could work very well at field days, outdoor birthday parties, picnics, beach outings, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very strong chemical smell out of the package. Smell went away after hanging outside for a week.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C.

customer_reviews.title: Not for sand spurs
customer_reviews.text: Durable and good size If you are buying these to fill them with sand and drag across the land to pick up sand spurs, Don't. I don't know if it's the wrong kind of sack or the old timers lied about their spur pick up methods, but it doesn't work
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for an archery target bag.
customer_reviews.text: Not as durable as the burlap sacks I purchase on ebay, seems to be of inferior quality. I stuff these sacks with plastic bags to use as archery targets. The larger bags I purchased on ebay held up to hundreds of shots, where this bag is starting to tear and fall apart after less than 50. Im using field tips, so the arrows aren't doing major damage to the sack. Will stick with the bags off ebay.
customer_reviews.author: Malka

customer_reviews.title: Great burlap sacks
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was perfect for my event this weekend. Perfect fit for kids and adults. Strong sturdy material. I received this on time and great packaging. I left it air out outside for a few hours because it does smell a little but not as bad or intolerable as other reviewers said. Thank you Farber Bag.
customer_reviews.author: Marcy

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: These were great! One had a hole in the side but for the price we can easily patch the hole. They are a little small but an average adult can fit in them.
customer_reviews.author: Ciara

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great fun for the kids. Worked well. Funny smell but worked after allowing to air out.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use as a “filling” for a Christmas crate that I was making. I planned to cut the bags in half and use a rectangle shaped piece to fill the crate. Not only were they dirty and full of wood chips, they smelled awful and when I tried to get rid of the smell, I couldn’t. So I just wasted my money and now I have to figure something else out to do for my Christmas gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great price but eventually tore but I had right at 1000 kids using them so I can't complain
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Bags have torn at the bottom, blowed right out after 1 use! However, I put 20 lbs of soil in it...so, if you want to use this for growing spuds, reenforce the bottom
customer_reviews.author: Necole

customer_reviews.title: I like them
customer_reviews.text: Love to use these to put the grandkids gifts in
customer_reviews.author: Chad & Nell

customer_reviews.title: Expensive potato sacks.
customer_reviews.text: They are potato sacks. At this price point, you'd expect them to be bespoke potato sacks designed by an artisan, lovingly crafted. Instead, you get a regular potato sack. It would normally hold potatoes, but I use them to collect leaf mulch. So if you want designer potato sacks to hold your mulch, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: egs

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Fast shipping.
customer_reviews.text: The product is great, exactly as described and seems to be of high quality. The one star deduction is for the strong scent of chemicals that came off of the bags when it was opens. I am sure it is harmless for the intent of this item, but I would not recommend storing food items in this until the scent has worn off or it is washed somehow. Also, very fast shipping. One of the only sellers that had same day shipping for this item.
customer_reviews.author: Batmaz

customer_reviews.title: These had a very chemically smell to them. I ...
customer_reviews.text: These had a very chemically smell to them. I let them air outside overnight for a couple days expecting the odor to pass, but unfortunately it did not. They look cute, but still stink. :(
customer_reviews.author: Roth

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Extra Money
customer_reviews.text: Yes, these are my expensive than what you can buy at a TSC or Southern States, but the quality is unbeatable, expecially if you are using these burlap sacks for sack race games. The opening is much bigger than anything sold at an ourdoor store and these bags are very durable and tall (so adults can play to) Definitely worth the extra money
customer_reviews.author: J. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Have fun
customer_reviews.text: Heavy & sturdy. Had a ball with these. Big enough for the children & adults
customer_reviews.author: G. Thnx

customer_reviews.title: I would purchase again, but...
customer_reviews.text: Price was okay. We used to plant some potatoes and leafy greens. Very durable originally, but with weathering ripped pretty easily with potatoes. I would purchase again, but not for gardening. Did have a strong smell when arrived, but if using for sack races or décor, airing out for a day or two should help.
customer_reviews.author: BrandyW

customer_reviews.title: no rips during the races however sacks come dirty and smelling quite awful
customer_reviews.text: Got the job done, fits adults well, no rips during the races however sacks come dirty and smelling quite awful. Would recommend opening and storing outside.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: Great deal. I have a ton of tropic bulbs that need to winter in my basement, and these are sturdy and hold them all. Yes, the burlap has a "weird smell", but that's how it smells. Plus, most likely you are using these for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a three legged race at a family picnic. They were just what I was looking for and very reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: dianec2020

customer_reviews.title: Great yard game
customer_reviews.text: These burlap sacks actually turned out pretty nice. They aren't numbered (we thought they were) but you could easily purchased stencils and spray paint and number them yourself. They are really for adults as children were almost swallowed up by the bag. fun and classic outdoor activity.
customer_reviews.author: Carzel Frazier

customer_reviews.title: They get the job done
customer_reviews.text: We used these for a second grade class picnic. The potato sack race was a big hit with the kids. The only problem is they could use more stickers for reinforcement on the sides. But they worked.
customer_reviews.author: Katieg

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I used these to fill with rocks to add some weight to the back of my truck for the winter time. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Party game
customer_reviews.text: Just got ten plan on using for family gathering Thanksgiving
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Radimer

customer_reviews.title: Thin
customer_reviews.text: These worked for our party but the bottom ripped out rather quickly. I guess if you just use 1 time it would be ok.
customer_reviews.author: KRynn Williams

customer_reviews.title: Durable!
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of places to buy burlap sacks for potato sack races, but many of them where so inexpensive, I was worried they'd rip. So I settled on these bags - and they worked perfectly! We had children aged almost 5 to a large 11 - plus adults - use these bags several times and they held up perfectly. NO rips or tears. The bags are in perfect condition and ready to be used at our next party!
customer_reviews.author: Kriswrite

customer_reviews.title: Nice big bags.  Good for 3-legged race.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely sewn. Smells a little funky. Will have to air them out before using.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Karpen

customer_reviews.title: Was a unique look and the receiver of the gift loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Actually used one of these to wrap a birthday gift. Was a unique look and the receiver of the gift loved it!
customer_reviews.author: SunnyD

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: We had to have a material that water could go through but that other material example sand dirt would not we used it for our sub pump so far it's working out just great
customer_reviews.author: sharon a jordan-parker

customer_reviews.title: fun fun fun
customer_reviews.text: Great material. Very satisfied with the purchase. If you are debating between these and the paper/plastic sacks, definitely go with burlap. My son and I raced in them once in anticipation of his upcoming party and we loved them. Other reviews mentioned a smell, didn't really smell anything out of the ordinary, it is burlap.
customer_reviews.author: Latoya

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommended to anyone
customer_reviews.text: Nasty smell, holes everywhere and lint and dirt spreading all over. Do not recommended to anyone. Definitely not your Burlap sacks one used to get years ago from your local grocecer 👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻
customer_reviews.author: Al Menendez

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed, used for archery targets and hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Broke out in rash
customer_reviews.text: Very itchy - broke out in rash. Had a terrible smell.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with these. I made them into feed bags for a farm themed party. They were large and made a fun prop.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Eads

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to place Christmas gifts in and used a stencil to decorate the outside of a bag with acrylic paints and it was the perfect Christmas bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Good for fishing.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for holding fish on my kayak. Can't put them on a stringer or the seals will steal them and tip me over. Strong smell when new. Chemical smell.
customer_reviews.author: S Bannon

customer_reviews.title: Smelled horribly of mold upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Smelled horribly of mold upon arrival. Couldn't bring the bags into the house. It filled the entire garage with the stinch. Tried airing out the bags in the sun. Three weeks later the smell of mold is still so strong that I was not able to use them for sack races for my children's party. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great value, fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Used for a voodoo doll Halloween costume for my daughter. Came fast. Just as described.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Learn to count.
customer_reviews.text: There were suppose to be 4, but I only received 3 which is a bummer because the part is tomorrow, we setup 4 lanes for the potato sack race and now we only have 3 sacks. The quality of the sacks is good, but like I said I needed 4.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Williams

customer_reviews.title: Sacks smell awful
customer_reviews.text: Got these sacks for kids to enjoy potato sack races. The size is great, and it looks like they will last, however the smell these bags are putting off is so awful. It is a very strong chemical smell. We had to put them outside because the smell consumed the living room. They've been airing out for days and the smell does not seem to have lessened. Other than that, they are fine. We just won't be keeping them in our home.
customer_reviews.author: DErin

customer_reviews.title: Great price and product!
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased these to go under our Christmas trees. They worked so nicely and will have more uses this year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for scarecrows for Halloween . I tried a craft store but their burlap was thin and cheap. This is definitely more what I was looking for. Tighter woven and pretty thick. It was perfect and what a great price.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Huge party hit!
customer_reviews.text: Huge hit T my daughters bday party! They kids loved racing in these sacks!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Overpowering chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: The sacks looked like they were made well, but the overpowering chemical smell made me send them back. I was going to use them to absorb moisture in my beehives but was afraid the chemical on them would kill my bees. I wouldn't want to step inside of one for a sack race, or have my children inside of them.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Brown

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting!!
customer_reviews.text: These were the most horrible things I have ever seen they smelled of kerosene or some type of something. Washed them many times could not get the smell out and they washed up horrible, Threw them out today Easter Sunday could not use them. Never Never order this product you will he very Disapponted
customer_reviews.author: teresa w baxley

customer_reviews.title: ... exactly when they said they would and in very good quality. I wanted something adults could use and ...
customer_reviews.text: These showed up exactly when they said they would and in very good quality. I wanted something adults could use and this fit the bill perfectly. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not wear shoes with this product.
customer_reviews.text: This reminds you of your younger years. I was hoping they were a little thicker. Works greats even for adults.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Bee

customer_reviews.title: Works for my basket gardens!
customer_reviews.text: Used these for strawberries and potatoes in my basket gardens and they worked well. They wouldn't last more than 1 growing season, however.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas B. Willcox

customer_reviews.title: Bags have pungent paint smell that made me feel sick. Had to return them.
customer_reviews.text: The bags have a pungent chemical odor. They smell like wet paint. Can't stand the smell so we put them in the garage. Now the garage smells like wet paint. Can't imagine what chemicals were used to treat the burlap fibers during production. This is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a church picnic and we had so much fun.
customer_reviews.author: angie w

customer_reviews.title: pets bed.
customer_reviews.text: perfect for pet bedding. Smells like burlap, so air out before use.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Very cool
customer_reviews.text: These burlap sacks were great for potato sack races. I was impressed with the size and quality. The only draw back is that they have a strong smell to them and they do leave "burlap" threads all over your clothes. However - for an outdoor party who cares? The size is also pretty good - can be used by an average size adult. (probably not an overweight adult).
customer_reviews.author: S. Porcher

customer_reviews.title: They're real potato sacks
customer_reviews.text: They're scratchy, and stinky, and stiff, like real potato sacks. They're also quite large, read the size carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Sendich

customer_reviews.title: These are just right!
customer_reviews.text: These were just what I needed, for our school field day. Good price, large enough for all sizes and durable enough to last the entire day and several races. I'm sure they have enough life in them to make it another year too. Previous sacks haven't even survived one day.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Not the best material but did the
customer_reviews.text: Big enough for adults. Not the best material but did the job
customer_reviews.author: nene

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my costuming needs
customer_reviews.text: Noticed no unusual or offensive smell as reported by other reviewers. These worked great for my scarecrow costuming needs.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: durable for adult use
customer_reviews.text: we used them for an adult birthday party and they held up very well. we will be using them for the next adult field day!
customer_reviews.author: Nye Simmons

product_meta.title: LA Linen Burlap Potato Sacks 23x40, Pack 4
product_meta.description: Color:NaturalThe sack race or gunny sack race is a competitive game in which participants place both of their legs inside a sack or pillow case that reaches their waist or neck and jump forward from a starting point toward a finish line. The first person to cross the finish line is the winner of the race. In some cases the winner of these races are rewarded with a prize of some sort. These sacks are made with natural jute burlap also known as hessian cloth.
feature_bullets: Size is approximately and may vary from 23" x 40". Sacks have a distinct scent and would dissipate over time when the sacks are aired out
The scent is from the natural fibers, an air purifier and germ killer. A reason this sack is used in storage of food and produce.
Order includes 4 potato sacks. Professionally clean
We recommend rolling your potato sacks to prevent creases and storing them in a dry cool place.
